channel.title: Error Connecting
channel.description:
This is probably a very simple fix for most of you out there, But the problem I am having is that of...
I made a server, I have portforwarded, I can play the server just fine. But then I tried to let my friend download the server and I used my client folder and used WinRar to compress it. And put that download onto a mediafire file. I was hoping if anyone could help me out and try and fix this problem.
Thanks, If you need Teamviewer Info just ask : P

item.title: Error Connecting
item.dc:creator: @Viz_Curse Viz Curse
item.description:
@Viz_Curse wrote:

Success: I can see your service on 98.224.—.--- on port (43594)
Your ISP is not blocking port 43594

Edit:
Well I can’t seem to be getting this done … I tried, And “mostwanted8” tried to help but my friend still can not connect, I’ll just give up with it then .-. ugh …

Read full topic

item.title: Error Connecting

well send me link of your client and ill try to see whats the problem

item.title: Error Connecting
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

use canyouseeme.org to see if your port is open, if that says off line you either didn’t port forward correctly or you didn’t add an exception to your firewall.

Read full topic

runescape is going really shitty side so rsps community is as well…[/quote]
That’s cool. Because you have obviously been here an INCREDIBLY long time, and you can make educated conclusions like that.
(Hint: Three days is not a long time at all. Gtfo)

item.title: Error Connecting
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

Viz Curse:

Yeah my friend cant connect to the server, It says Error Connecting. For him

You say it works for you, but not him, and you have portforwarded… This leads me to believe that you may have forgotten to change the IP in the client, which IP is used in the client, if it’s localhost, that’s why.

Read full topic
